channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: IRS says it will refund taxes extracted from Ohioans who got financial assistance after Norfolk Southern derailment disaster
item.description: “I don’t know why they didn’t do that from the very beginning,” East Palestine resident Misti Allison said.

item.title: F1's new regulations suggest car makers are not done with the internal combustion engine yet
item.description: In 2026, F1 cars will be powered by hybrid engines with a 50:50 split between electric-power and internal combustion.

item.title: Some investors who tried to buy the Berkshire glitch dip got full-price shares
Zero percent down mortgages might help more first-time homebuyers break into the housing market—but there are caveats
item.description: United Wholesale Mortgage announced a 0% down program last month, and since then it’s been all the rage, but people are split: Does it eliminate a barrier or will it launch us into another subprime mortgage crisis?

item.title: Slamming China over its stance on Russia and the war, Ukraine might have made a big miscalculation
item.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's very public criticism of China over its relationship with Russia could backfire.

item.title: GameStop shares resume rally, seal highest close in 3 weeks
Kansas politicians relaunch effort to steal Kansas City Chiefs from neighboring Missouri after a $1 billion taxpayer-funded plan fizzled
item.description: After an earlier stadium-financing plan fell through, Kansas legislators are trying a new tactic to bring the Chiefs across the state border.

item.title: Payhawk, a $1 billion corporate card startup, plans M&A shopping spree to boost its U.S. footprint
item.description: Bulgarian-founded corporate card startup Payhawk said it is targeting acquisitions to help it grow its footprint in the U.S.

item.title: Nvidia is now worth more than $3 trillion — and worth more than Apple
Short seller Scorpion Capital accuses Japan’s most actively traded company of being the ‘largest outright fraud in the world’
item.description: Hedge fund targets niche semiconductor company that’s rode AI demand for huge gains since 2019.

item.title: EU elections kick off against a backdrop of China disputes, 'greenlash' and possible Trump return
item.description: CNBC takes a look at why this election matters for Europe and the rest of the world.

item.title: S&P 500, Nasdaq close at records as Nvidia surpasses $3 trillion market cap
New York governor abruptly cancels nation's first 'congestion pricing' system that would have charged $15 to drive into midtown Manhattan
item.description: The $15 charge "can break the budget of a hardworking or middle class household," Kathy Hochul said.

item.title: Scientists have unlocked a key to powering an ultra-thin battery that can fit on your eyeball
item.description: Scientists have developed a 0.2 mm battery that can be charged by tears, bringing smart contact lenses closer to reality.

item.title: Amazon union in New York adds Teamsters affiliation before ratification vote
